books.title: Patron Saints of Nothing
books.author: Randy Ribay
books.summary:
A coming-of-age story about grief, guilt,
            and the risks a Filipino-American teenager takes to
            uncover the truth about his cousin's murder. Jay Reguero
            plans to spend the last semester of his senior year playing
            video games before heading to the University of Michigan in the fall.

reviews.firstReview:
Brilliant, honest, and equal parts heartbreaking and
                      soul-healing. - Laurie Halse Anderson, author of SHOUT

reviews.secondReview:
Passionately and fearlessly, Ribay delves into matters
                      of justice, grief, and identity. - Publishers Weekly

reviews.thirdReview:
Complex, gripping, haunting and deeply human… a story
                      alive with longing and pain and grace.  – Kelly Gilbert, author
                      of Picture Us In The Light

books.title: An Infinite Number of Parallel Universes
books.author: Randy Ribay
books.summary:
Told in the narrative style of Akira Kurosawa's RASHOMAN, AN INFINITE
            NUMBER OF PARALLEL UNIVERSES is at turns geeky, funny, and lyrical as it tells a
            story about that time in life when friends need each other to become more than just
             people that hang out together.

reviews.firstReview:
Level up in this compelling adventure that tests the heroics of
                        four friends who can't use cheat codes to solve their personal trials. Experience
                        Points await readers! - Adam Silvera, author of More Happy Than Not

reviews.secondReview:
Debut novelist Ribay gives the story a distinctively diverse and
                        nerd-centric cast. - Publishers Weekly

reviews.thirdReview:
A novel written by a geek, for geeks, that manages to touch on so much,
                        and packs a surprising, emotional punch. The characters and their journey together will
                        stick with you for a while. - BookRiot

books.title: After The Shot Drops
books.author: Randy Ribay
books.summary:
A powerful novel about friendship, basketball, and one teen's mission to create a
            better life for his family in the tradition of Jason Reynolds, Matt de la Pena, and Walter Dean
            Myers. Bunny and Nasir have been best friends forever, but when Bunny accepts an athletic
            scholarship across town, Nasir feels betrayed.

reviews.firstReview:
Without a doubt, Ribay’s compelling book belongs on the shelf alongside
                        contemporary heavy-hitters like Angie Thomas’s The Hate U Give, Brendan Kiely and Jason
                        Reynolds’s All-American Boys, and Nic Stone’s Dear Martin. - School Library Journal

reviews.secondReview:
A well-executed book featuring complex, diverse characters we rarely
                         meet—a real winner for its heartbeat, compassion, and integrity. - Kirkus

reviews.thirdReview:
As the boys take tentative steps to salvage their friendship, they
                        navigate high-stakes choices and consider the value of loyalty, integrity, and sacrifice
                        in a story driven by fast-paced drama on and off the court. - Publishers Weekly
